title: Ocean Week 2016 - Grand Prize Update!
body:
Hey everyone we thought it was time to give you an update on the Ocean Week 2016 grand prize.

As you might remember the prize for last year was the creation of a large painted mural created by the community and adapted by a famous artist plus a plaque containing all the player names that reached the required number of points. 

**So whats the delay?**

We had identified a number of locations for the mural in Sydney, our first location was in the Bondi area on the side of a local restaurant, but unfortunately this fell through in the last stages of approvals. 

Our next favored location was the Bondi Beach Sea Wall. To obtain permission to paint the mural on the sea wall you have to go through local council approval. Each year many artists compete to paint a section of the sea wall and unfortunately we did not gain approval. It's a blow as its an awesome location but this is not the end of the 2016 Ocean Week wall.

Caspian De Looze, who is a famous tattoo/artist from Sydney, has worked with the winners of last years art competition and has completed the mural and is poised and ready to paint our next chosen location.

**So what are the next steps? **

We are working to find a new location so that we can have the mural painted as soon as possible so we can celebrate all the players that took part in Ocean Week 2016. We will keep you posted and let you all know when we have secured our location.

If you have any questions throw them in the comments below and I will do my best to answer them all.

Thanks
GeneralCoxy

replies.body: Don't just look at the rich areas! There's plenty of space along the inner west train line near St Peters where graffiti artists have their say.... perhaps reserve a spot there :) Or in Redfern :) Failing that, contact Parramatta City Council, they are a good bunch of blokes who should be able to sort something out.
Great point - we are looking at loads of locations at the moment. Thanks for the suggestions.
Riot would prefer that it was in a bigger area that is a tourist spot though, for obvious reasons.

You can't go into the inner west area, unless you want other people to paint over it. I reckon Near Botany Bay would've been better, near the airport, or someone close to Darling Harbour, buts thats just my two cents

I know Riot OCE is based in Sydney, but what about in Victoria! We have amazing stretches of beaches and some amazing spots it could go along St Kilda/Luna Park! I personally think each year the grand prize should change locations! Just a suggestion though!  {{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}

solar and lunar for the girls
Astro and Comet for the boys
How about Manly or somewhere on the northern beaches?
What will be the mural? will it contain player names like the nautilus statue?
Hi, yes there will be a plaque with all the qualifying players names on the wall.

Last year's Ocean Week featured an art contest to decide who would assist in the mural's design. As for names "there will be plaque containing all the player names that reached the required number of points."

Here's a better explanation from the official page:

>Congratulations to grand prize winner Joelin 'Fainaru' T. for her beautiful piece of art 'Defenders of Oceania'! Joelin will be collaborating with a prolific street artist to create a wall mural at a cool location somewhere in Oceania. It'll be part of a community wall that features the names of all summoners that contributed 10 or more points during Ocean Week. The name of the street artist and the location of the wall will be announced at a later date.

>Here's a link: http://oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/community/community-spotlight/announcing-ocean-week-contest-winners
